search_query: Cadence CDNS competitors 2025 EDA semiconductor design
context: Cadence is a leading EDA provider with approximately 30% market share in semiconductor design software. The company focuses on functional verification and custom IC design services. In 2025, Cadence announced major acquisitions: Secure-IC (January 2025) for embedded security IP, and Hexagon's design and engineering business including MSC Software for €2.7 billion (~$3.16 billion) in September 2025. In July 2025, Cadence pled guilty to criminal charges for illegally exporting semiconductor design technology to China's NUDT and paid over $140 million in penalties. Both Cadence and Synopsys are expected to grow at 15-20%+ CAGRs over the next 5 years.

competitors.name: Synopsys
competitors.notes: Primary competitor with approximately 30% market share. Focuses on comprehensive design platforms. In December 2024, Nvidia announced a multi-year strategic partnership and $2 billion investment in Synopsys to integrate AI and accelerated computing capabilities. Synopsys completed $35 billion acquisition of ANSYS in July 2025.

competitors.name: Siemens EDA
competitors.notes: Formerly Mentor Graphics, with approximately 13% market share. Third-largest player in the EDA oligopoly. Part of Siemens AG with benefits from broader industrial software integration.

competitors.name: Empyrean
competitors.notes: China's largest domestic EDA vendor. Part of China's effort to invest in their EDA ecosystem, though still very small compared to Cadence and Synopsys.

competitors.name: MSC Software
competitors.notes: Part of Hexagon's design and engineering business. Being acquired by Cadence in September 2025 for €2.7 billion. Provider of engineering simulation and analysis software.
